kpi_categories.definition: Does this solve the core contradiction without compromise?
kpi_categories.score_1_poor: Compromise: Solves the problem but creates new harmful side effects.
kpi_categories.score_5_excellent: Ideal: Solves inherently using existing energy/resources; no downsides.

kpi_categories.definition: Is the science ready? Do we know how to build it?
kpi_categories.score_1_poor: Basic Research: Theoretical only. Requires inventing new physics/algorithms.
kpi_categories.score_5_excellent: Proven: Mature technology (TRL 9). Uses standard engineering practices.

kpi_categories.definition: Are the raw materials, chips, or specific tech components actually purchasable/accessible?
kpi_categories.score_1_poor: Scarcity: Relies on rare earth metals, single-source vendors, or embargoed tech.
kpi_categories.score_5_excellent: Ubiquitous: Uses commodity materials (steel, plastic), open-source code, or standard off-the-shelf chips.

kpi_categories.definition: What is the impact on Bill of Materials (BOM) and Operational Cost?
kpi_categories.score_1_poor: Expensive: Significant increase in unit cost (>10%).
kpi_categories.score_5_excellent: Cost-Negative: Reduces unit cost (removes parts) or is free (software only).

kpi_categories.definition: Is this idea unique enough to patent or create a competitive moat?
kpi_categories.score_1_poor: Obvious: Prior art exists; competitors already do this.
kpi_categories.score_5_excellent: Breakthrough: Highly unique; strong potential for a defensible patent.

kpi_categories.definition: How fast can this specific solution be deployed into the product line?
kpi_categories.score_1_poor: Long-Term: >2 years (requires re-tooling, certification, or new factory).
kpi_categories.score_5_excellent: Immediate: <3 months (OTA software update or minor assembly change).
